subsection.name: 2.5.1 Upgrading Project XML Files
subsection.p: Opening a 1.0 projects in CayenneModeler would display an upgrade dialog. Select "Yes" button to perform the upgrade.
subsection.panel: Upgrading a project to 1.1 will make it unusable with earlier versions of Cayenne.

subsection.name: 2.5.2 Clean Recompile
subsection.p: Cayenne 1.1 introduces a few API changes. Most of them are done to the backend and should not affect the applications written with the earlier versions. However it is a good idea to perform a clean compilation of all Java code that relies on Cayenne. Updating calls to deprecated methods is a good idea as well.

subsection.name: 2.5.3 Cleaning Stale Modeler Preferences
subsection.p: Cayenne 1.1 almost completely switched its preferences engine to use an embedded HSQL database, however a number of preferences are still loaded from the old preferences file. As a result a number of bugs associated with the old preferences may reappear in 1.1, even though they were fixed. To clean old preferences shut down all running instances of CayenneModeler, then delete a file $HOME/.cayenne/modeler.preferences. $HOME is a user home directory which is OS and machine specific.
